page.title: 02MIRE END FARM :CAIRNEYHILL
page.content: The farm is owned by Mr Duncan, and he has lived there for nine years .It is on the outskirts of Cairneyhill village and consists of 182 acres of mixed land, with winter barley, spring barley, 84 cattle and 200 sheep. The farm has only 2 workers, himself and his wife, but he has many machines e.g. 3 tractors,2 ploughs,2 balers, etc. He faces the problem of his crops drying up in the summer,so he has to irrigate them,and his land is also split in two by a railway line which takes coal trains to the Longannet power station .Some old huts on the farm, used as bases for soldiers in the second world war, are now used for storage. As its name suggests, there is also an area of the farm where the land is too marshy to be used for crop growing. It is left for rough grazing.
